## GitHub Issue Summary: "Pieces Desktop Shows Error Message 'Empty Please Try Again'" 

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are encountering an error message saying "Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again" when attempting to send messages.
* This issue appears to be affecting users on both macOS and Windows after updating to the latest version. 
* Sending the first message in a new chat seems possible, but subsequent messages fail.

* Pieces support bot provided links to related issues and resources.
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and released a patch to address it.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The patch has been released and the issue has been resolved according to user confirmation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The specific cause of the error message is not explicitly mentioned in the conversation.

## Overall, this conversation demonstrates effective communication and issue resolution by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Issue Summary: 

**Key points:**
* MoyinShabi was experiencing problems when trying to connect Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS after a recent update.
* They reported not receiving any notification regarding a Health Check.
* They shared log files and folders with Pieces team members for troubleshooting.

**Identified problems:**
* Database issue with Pieces for Developers.
* Inability to reproduce the original issue of the application not booting.

**Proposed/Implemented solutions:**
* A repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder was shared for replacement.
* A video call was suggested for further live troubleshooting.

**Current status/Outcome:**
* MoyinShabi reported the issue persisting even after replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* They provided additional information about the error message observed in the logs.
* A video call is scheduled for further troubleshooting.

**Additional notes:**
* The specific cause of the problem is still being investigated.
* Pieces team members are actively engaged in resolving the issue.

related_issues.text:

macOS

```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!

related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User `seantiz` reported a bug where the Copilot wasn't responding properly to questions after 11 requests and responses.
* No files were loaded into the context.
* User was unable to narrow down the steps to reproduce the bug.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot malfunctioning and not responding to user requests.
* Context not being loaded into the conversation.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* `mark-at-pieces` suggested switching to the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
* User confirmed that the bug did not occur with Flash.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The bug seems to be resolved by using the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
* Further investigation into the root cause of the bug is likely needed.

**Additional notes:**

* The user was directed to some helpful resources, including existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the proper Pieces team member.

## Conclusion

The issue appears to be resolved by switching to the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM. Further investigation into the root cause of the bug is likely warranted.

common_issues.description: Users report issues installing Pieces OS to a desired location and launching Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers. This seems to stem from installer limitations and potential conflicts with system resources. Solutions include using alternative installers, adjusting system settings, and providing logs for debugging.

related_issues.title: Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
related_issues.text:
Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Key Points:**

* User reported an issue being unable to choose the installation location for Pieces OS.
* Pieces support bot triaged the issue and suggested related issues and resources.
* Pieces support representative nathan-courtney-pieces identified two potential causes:
    * Installing via App Installer (MSIX) package prevents location choice.
    * Installing via Pieces for Developers might not offer location choice.
* Suggested solutions:
    * Install using InnoSetup (EXE) installer to choose location.
    * If installed via Pieces for Developers, uninstall and reinstall using the Setup Executable.
* Current status: User data location choice is not yet available, planned for future release.

**Outcome:**

The user can now choose the Pieces OS installation location by using the InnoSetup installer. User data location choice is not yet available but will be rolled out in the future.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of launch and connection issues:** The most frequent issues revolve around Pieces Desktop failing to launch or connect to Pieces OS. Focus on identifying the root causes and implementing fixes for these issues to improve user experience.

**Investigate and address LTM engine activation problems:** Issues related to LTM engine activation are causing user frustration. Investigate the permissions issues and other potential causes to ensure smooth LTM functionality.
**Improve communication around updates:** Many issues arise after updates. Enhance communication about upcoming updates, including potential impacts and troubleshooting steps, to prepare users.

**Provide clear guidance on installation and data storage:** Users are seeking more control over installation locations and data storage. Provide clear documentation and options to address these concerns.

**Review and address antivirus compatibility:** Investigate reports of antivirus software flagging Pieces OS as a virus. Collaborate with antivirus vendors or adjust the software to prevent false positives and ensure compatibility.

**Continue monitoring and addressing bugs and unexpected behavior:**  Maintain a system for tracking and addressing bugs and unexpected behavior reported by users. Prioritize issues based on frequency and severity to ensure continuous improvement of the app's stability and functionality.

**Consider user feedback for future development:**  Incorporate user feedback, such as requests for installation location choices and data storage options, into future development plans to enhance user experience and address evolving needs.
